basic_info.name: RGUKT, Nuzvid Admissions
description: RGUKT admits 1000 students every year for the integrated B.Tech course, out of which 85% of total available seats shall be reserved for ‘local candidates’ (Andhra Pradesh) and the remaining 15% of the seats are open to the students of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana states.

basic_info.name: RGUKT, Nuzvid Placements
description: The institute has a ‘Career development & Placement cell’ formulated that catalyses placements from the campus to various high profile companies. About 60% students are offered placements, which starts from 3rd year of the course. Some of RGUKT’s top recruiters are –

basic_info.name: RGUKT, Nuzvid Scholarships
description: RGUKT offers scholarships, sponsored by the Govt. of Andhra Pradesh to all students, including ones belonging to reservation category & minority. The scholarship includes the course fees & hostel fees. The Govt. offers partial or full reimbursement to the eligible students. Non SC/ST candidates having annual parent income less than Rs. 1 Lac & SC/ST candidates with annual parent income below Rs. 2 Lac are eligible for reimbursement of fee, subject to fulfilling other conditions set by the Govt. Besides, a financial assistance scheme is available for students from pre-final & final years.

description: Following are some of the facilities offered by RGUKT:

basic_info.name: RGUKT, Nuzvid Faculty
description: RGUKT consists of 100+ faculty members, out of which 13 hold PhD in their respective subjects. The staff is experienced & highly qualified from reputed universities. Prof H Sudarsana Rao is the Dean/ Principal of RGUKT, RK Valley. The university consists of 18 departments, having – Head of Department, Professors & Associate professors.

faqs.question: Ques: What documents do the students need to carry for verification, if selected for the counseling at RGUKT?
faqs.answer: Ans: Candidates are required to carry 3 sets of the following, along with original documents.RGUKT CET statement of marksRGUKT Rank CardHall Ticket - 10th ClassResidence certificateCaste certificate, if applicableEWS certificate, if applicable

faqs.question: Ques: Is education at RGUKT free of cost?
faqs.answer: Ans: All candidates have to pay mandatory fees like Application fee, Registration fee & refundable caution fees. Candidates belonging to SC/ST category have a slightly lesser amount, but are no exception to paying the above mentioned fees. The student has to create a bank account into which the Govt. may transfer the scholarship amount, based on the category. The university then records this amount against the fees of the candidate. Any due amount remaining apart from deductions from the scholarship; must be paid by the candidate. RGUKT also assists the students with setting up the bank account initially.

faqs.question: Ques: How is the B.Tech course curriculum at RGUKT?
faqs.answer: Ans: The integrated B.Tech program consists of – 2 years Pre-University course (PUC) & 4 year Engineering course. The PUC consists of Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, English, Telugu and Information Technology. After the successful completion of PUC, the candidate can choose the desired BTech specialization out of the 7 available. The exams are conducted in Descriptive & Optional mode.

faqs.question: Ques: What are the criteria for Branch allocation at RGUKT?
faqs.answer: Ans: The candidate is allotted the chosen branch based on merit, through an online process set up by RGUKT. Seats available for each branch are decided by the number of students passing the PUC course. The tentative numbers of seats under each branch are -Chemical Engineering - 60Civil Engineering – 120 or 180Computer Science Engineering - 300Electronics and Communication Engineering - 300Mechanical Engineering - 180Metallurgical and Material Engineering - 60

faqs.question: Ques: What are the internship opportunities at RGUKT?
faqs.answer: Ans: Students at RGUKT are encouraged to undertake Summer internships or Long-term internships, linked to the student’s educational goals. In-house or company internships can be done by the student for a minimum period of 6 weeks. Students can qualify for the internship offered after passing the tests & interviews. Some internships offer stipend too.

faqs.question: Ques: Does the campus of RGUKT have facilities for Physically challenged students?
faqs.answer: Ans: Yes, about 3% of the total admission seats are reserved for the Physically challenged students. The campus infrastructure provides a comfortable atmosphere for such students as well. The institution buildings have facilities such as – Lifts, ramps, walking aids, wheelchairs, aids for transportation from one building to another & specially designed toilets for physically handicapped students.

Section.name: About RGUKT
Section.description:
Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge & Technology popularly known as RGUKT was established in 2008 by the Government of Andhra Pradesh. RGUKT AP has four residential campuses in RK Valley, Ongole, Srikakulam and Nuzvid. RGUKT is accredited with NAAC B+ Grade and recognized by UGC.
RGUKT offers Integrated B.Tech, M.Tech and Ph.D. courses. Admission to the institute is based on merit in RGUKT CET. The institute also offers placement opportunities. According to the NIRF 2024 report, RGUKT’s median salary for B.Tech is INR 4.54 LPA and 396 students got placed out of 1134 students in 2023.

RGUKT admits 1000 students every year for the integrated B.Tech course, out of which 85% of total available seats shall be reserved for ‘local candidates’ (Andhra Pradesh) and the remaining 15% of the seats are open to the students of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana states.

Ques: Is education at RGUKT free of cost?
Ans: All candidates have to pay mandatory fees like Application fee, Registration fee & refundable caution fees. Any due amount remaining apart from deductions from the scholarship; must be paid by the candidate. RGUKT also assists the students with setting up the bank account initially.

After the successful completion of PUC, the candidate can choose the desired BTech specialization out of the 7 available. The exams are conducted in Descriptive & Optional mode.
